Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different habitats, such as a playground, garden, forest, or pond.
The student can include various plants in their drawings, like trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants.
The student can include different animals in their drawings, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams.
The student can show the diversity of plants and animals within each habitat in their drawings.
The student can illustrate comparisons by drawing different types of living things found in different habitats side by side.
The student can use their drawings to represent patterns of plant and animal diversity across different habitats.
